issue.title: Configure Renovate
issue.body:
Welcome to [Renovate](https://renovatebot.com)! This is an onboarding PR to help you understand and configure settings before regular Pull Requests begin. :vertical_traffic_light: To activate Renovate, merge this Pull Request. To disable Renovate, simply close this Pull Request unmerged. --- ### Detected Package Files * `app/gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties` (gradle-wrapper) * `gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties` (gradle-wrapper) ### Configuration Summary Based on the default config's presets, Renovate will: - Start dependency updates only once this Configure Renovate PR is merged - Separate major versions of dependencies into individual branches/PRs - Do not separate patch and minor upgrades into separate PRs for the same dependency - Upgrade to unstable versions only if the existing version is unstable - Raise PRs immediately (after branch is created) - If semantic commits detected, use semantic commit type fix for dependencies and chore for all others - Keep existing branches updated even when not scheduled - Disable automerging feature - wait for humans to merge all PRs - Ignore `node_modules`, `bower_components`, `vendor` and various test/tests directories - Update existing lock files only when package.json is modified - Autodetect whether to pin dependencies or maintain ranges - Rate limit PR creation to a maximum of two per hour - Limit to maximum 20 open PRs at any time - Group known monorepo packages together - Use curated list of recommended non-monorepo package groupings :abcd: Would you like to change the way Renovate is upgrading your dependencies? Simply edit the `renovate.json` in this branch with your custom config and the list of Pull Requests in the "What to Expect" section below will be updated the next time Renovate runs. --- You have configured Renovate to use branch `master` as base branch. ### What to Expect With your current configuration, Renovate will create 2 Pull Requests:
Update dependency gradle to v4.10.3 - Schedule: "at any time" - Branch name: `renovate/gradle-4.x` - Merge into: `master` - Upgrade [gradle](https://togithub.com/gradle/gradle) to `4.10.3`
Update dependency gradle to v6 - Schedule: "at any time" - Branch name: `renovate/gradle-6.x` - Merge into: `master` - Upgrade [gradle](https://togithub.com/gradle/gradle) to `6.0.0`
--- :question: Got questions? Check out Renovate's [Docs](https://docs.renovatebot.com/), particularly the Getting Started section. If you need any further assistance then you can also [request help here](https://togithub.com/renovatebot/config-help/issues). --- This PR has been generated by [Renovate Bot](https://togithub.com/marketplace/renovate). View repository job log [here](https://renovatebot.com/dashboard#uclaradio/uclaradio-android).

rename.from: Switch to tabbed view and do general code cleanup.

issue.title: Add Chat to UCLA Radio Android
issue.body:
## Overview

Added a chat box to the app. Now, users can swipe up or tap on a bar at the bottom of the screen to bring up a chat box, where they can interact with other listeners or the DJ on air live, just like on the website!

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Refactor (change which changes the codebase without affecting its external behavior)
- [x] Non-breaking change (fix or feature that would causes existing functionality to work as expected)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to __not__ work as expected)

## Purpose
Much-requested feature, let listeners communicate, yadda yadda yadda

## Learning
Had to learn how socket.io works, cause I've literally never used it before and that's what the website uses for handling chat.

## Screenshot(s) 

Click on each image below to enlarge.

**Collapsed** | **Expanded** | **Preparing message** | **Sent message**
---|---|---|---
![chat-collapsed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/51505701-102d8380-1d9d-11e9-8876-f93f25f11661.png) | ![chat-expanded](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/51505707-14f23780-1d9d-11e9-846f-13fc6a32487b.png) | ![chat-prepare](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/51505710-1c194580-1d9d-11e9-8236-bcf5aa759fd8.png) | ![chat-sent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/51505712-21769000-1d9d-11e9-8cdb-6d4280533d82.png)

## Known Issues

* The about page faced some minor display issues caused by the addition of the BottomSheet for chat (specifically, the Views holding the "About" text and the links to social media have been pushed upwards to the point where they're overlapped by the ActionBar). I "fixed" it by throwing about 15 newlines (`\n`) into the about string, but that's a _horrible_ and hopefully temporary fix.

## Further Comments

* The first few commits include some minor updates to gradle stuff and the `.gitignore`.

issue.title: Mockup for Android & iOS Design Merge
Mockup for Android & iOS Design Merge
Add Chat
issue.body:
Verbal copy from Nathan's
"We have this really cool chat feature on uclaradio.com:
![screen shot 2017-04-06 at 10 41 04 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5677971/24767905/93eb3128-1ab5-11e7-9c5a-59dd026a207d.png)

But our mobile listeners can't chat 😞. That is, until you close this pull request!

This is probably gonna be a pretty big change: you're going to need to mockup and create a new chat view and interface with our website somehow. If you have any questions about how chat works on the site, @hsuregan is the person to ask"

PR Referenced
[17](https://github.com/uclaradio/uclaradio-iOS/issues/17)

issue.title: Add Chat
issue.body:
Verbal copy from Nathan's
"We have this really cool chat feature on uclaradio.com:
![screen shot 2017-04-06 at 10 41 04 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5677971/24767905/93eb3128-1ab5-11e7-9c5a-59dd026a207d.png)

But our mobile listeners can't chat 😞. That is, until you close this pull request!

This is probably gonna be a pretty big change: you're going to need to mockup and create a new chat view and interface with our website somehow. If you have any questions about how chat works on the site, @hsuregan is the person to ask"

PR Referenced
[17](https://github.com/uclaradio/uclaradio-iOS/issues/17)

dismissed_review.dismissal_message: Has been addressed via Arjun's PR

issue.title: Revamped UCLA Radio Android
issue.body:
## Overview
Visually, pretty much gave the app a whole new makeover: added a background, some layout changes, and gave it a splash screen, among other things. I also changed up the app icon; I like this one a little better but the old one's still in there if needed.
Functionality-wise, I moved the streaming code into its own Service so that it could a) load and run on its own, separate from the UI thread and the main activity's lifecycle and b) be controlled while the user is using other apps/the device is locked. Good thing was, all the REST boilerplate stuff with Retrofit, including functions and interfaces, was already implemented so that saved me the trouble.
More details and specifics can be found in the commit history.

## Types of changes

- [x] Bugfix (change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (change which adds functionality)
- [x] Refactor (change which changes the codebase without affecting its external behavior)
- [x] Non-breaking change (fix or feature that would causes existing functionality to work as expected)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to __not__ work as expected)

## Purpose

We need an Android app lol

## Screenshot(s) 

**Video [here](https://photos.app.goo.gl/L6lj4Wlu2DlXlE0h2).**
Click on each image below to enlarge.

| Splash Screen | Stream | Shows | DJs | About | Notification |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962269-714eba88-55fe-11e8-89a6-695cf4e704cc.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962672-10f410e0-560b-11e8-8304-3c1f7d4ea0bb.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962271-783142d0-55fe-11e8-935b-7cdb09896135.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962272-7a3916b6-55fe-11e8-91fc-8a3927c7d176.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962273-7c751056-55fe-11e8-9798-24a39f27d176.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962677-1ca50750-560b-11e8-934c-0259bbd1da5c.png)|

## Known Issues

- When the user pauses the stream and resumes, it picks up from where it left off instead of keeping synced with the actual station in real time. It turns out that (I think) this is a problem with SHOUTcast and not the app, because the same effect happens on the website and at uclaradio.com:8000.
- If the connection to the server is dropped for too long (I haven't figured out the exact time, but it's definitely only for a while, maybe a few minutes?), the app won't reconnect; the user'll have to restart it.
- On the DJs grid, probably due to the CircleImageView library, the images pop into the view abruptly even after Picasso loads them.

## Further Comments

As of now the only device this app has really been tested on is my own, which is a few years old now, running Android 7.1.1 (Nougat).

| Splash Screen | Stream | Shows | DJs | About | Notification |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962269-714eba88-55fe-11e8-89a6-695cf4e704cc.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962672-10f410e0-560b-11e8-8304-3c1f7d4ea0bb.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962271-783142d0-55fe-11e8-935b-7cdb09896135.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962272-7a3916b6-55fe-11e8-91fc-8a3927c7d176.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962273-7c751056-55fe-11e8-9798-24a39f27d176.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962677-1ca50750-560b-11e8-934c-0259bbd1da5c.png)|

## Known Issues

- When the user pauses the stream and resumes, it picks up from where it left off instead of keeping synced with the actual station in real time. It turns out that (I think) this is a problem with SHOUTcast and not the app, because the same effect happens on the website and at uclaradio.com:8000.
- If the connection to the server is dropped for too long (I haven't figured out the exact time, but it's definitely only for a while, maybe a few minutes?), the app won't reconnect; the user'll have to restart it.
- On the DJs grid, probably due to the CircleImageView library, the images pop into the view abruptly even after Picasso loads them.

## Further Comments

As of now the only device this app has really been tested on is my own, which is a few years old now, running Android 7.1.1 (Nougat).

issue.title: Revamped UCLA Radio Android
issue.body:
## Overview
Visually, pretty much gave the app a whole new makeover: added a background, some layout changes, and gave it a splash screen, among other things. I also changed up the app icon; I like this one a little better but the old one's still in there if needed.
Functionality-wise, I moved the streaming code into its own Service so that it could a) load and run on its own, separate from the UI thread and the main activity's lifecycle and b) be controlled while the user is using other apps/the device is locked. Good thing was, all the REST boilerplate stuff with Retrofit, including functions and interfaces, was already implemented so that saved me the trouble.
More details and specifics can be found in the commit history.

## Types of changes

- [x] Bugfix (change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (change which adds functionality)
- [x] Refactor (change which changes the codebase without affecting its external behavior)
- [x] Non-breaking change (fix or feature that would causes existing functionality to work as expected)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to __not__ work as expected)

## Purpose

We need an Android app lol

## Screenshot(s) 

**Video [here](https://photos.app.goo.gl/L6lj4Wlu2DlXlE0h2).**
Click on each image below to enlarge.

| Splash Screen | Stream | Shows | DJs | About | Notification |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962269-714eba88-55fe-11e8-89a6-695cf4e704cc.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962672-10f410e0-560b-11e8-8304-3c1f7d4ea0bb.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962271-783142d0-55fe-11e8-935b-7cdb09896135.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962272-7a3916b6-55fe-11e8-91fc-8a3927c7d176.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962273-7c751056-55fe-11e8-9798-24a39f27d176.png)|![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30734384/39962677-1ca50750-560b-11e8-934c-0259bbd1da5c.png)|

## Known Issues

- When the user pauses the stream and resumes, it picks up from where it left off instead of keeping synced with the actual station in real time. It turns out that (I think) this is a problem with SHOUTcast and not the app, because the same effect happens on the website and at uclaradio.com:8000.
- If the connection to the server is dropped for too long (I haven't figured out the exact time, but it's definitely only for a while, maybe a few minutes?), the app won't reconnect; the user'll have to restart it.
- On the DJs grid, probably due to the CircleImageView library, the images pop into the view abruptly even after Picasso loads them.

## Further Comments

As of now the only device this app has really been tested on is my own, which is a few years old now, running Android 7.1.1 (Nougat).
